channel.title: Projects on Janine Cheong
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Janine Cheong

item.title: Major Project # 1: Predicting Top 50 S&P 500 Stock Market Prices
item.description: Forecasting can be defined as the prediction of some future event by analyzing historical data. This project aims to predict the closing stock price of Top 50 S&P 500 companies using the past 60-day stock price and comparing the results using different ML/DL models. Moreover, the aim of the project is to provide support for beginners as a general guide on the price predictions. It also aims to identify application opportunities of machine learning in the stock market - bridging whether the technical analysis follows the model used.

item.title: Major Project # 2: Analyzing World Happiness Report 2019
item.description: The World Happiness Report measures the overall state of global happiness by factoring in each country’s status in economy, health, social support, government trust, etc. and ranks the countries by how happy their citizens perceive themselves to be. Since it covers different factors, it can be a useful guide to measure policy effectiveness and good governance and assess the quality of life among countries. Proponents of the project are Janine Cheong, Raymund Norada, Karen Salas, and Maico Rebong.

item.title: Visualizing 2020 New York Traffic Accidents using Power BI
item.description: The dataset for this dashboard was obtained from Maven Analytics which aims to analyze motor vehicle collisions in New York City from January to August 2020. Every record represents an individual collision containing details about the date, time, location of the accident, vehicles, victims involved and contributing factors. It can be seen that out of the 5 boroughs, Brooklyn is home to the biggest distribution of fatalities. The highest contributing factor to the collisions is due to distracted driving.

item.title: Replication of Maven Analytics Queen's Gambit Challenge Entry
item.description: This dashboard analyzes data for over 20,000 chess games played on Lichess containing records about the winner, player ratings, moves, time increments, etc. The dataset was obtained from Maven Analytics and this dashboard is only for Power BI practice purposes and has replicated one of the entries of the Queen’s Gambit Challenge. We can see in the dashboard that, with the first-move advantage, White has the highest number of wins by resignation in terms of victory status.

item.title: Exploring the Bitcoin Cryptocurrency Market
item.description: With a lot more people being exposed to trading these days, cryptocurrency, especially Bitcoin, has become a great investment for people and companies. In this project, we will be using different data importing and cleaning, data manipulation, and data visualization techniques from basic Python to explore the Bitcoin Cryptocurrency Market. This project is created through the DataCamp guided projects. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Predicting Credit Card Approvals
item.description: Applications for credit cards in commercial banks can come in high volume and approvals can be tedious. Many of them get rejected for many reasons, like high loan balances, low income levels, etc. With that, manually analyzing these applications is mundane, error-prone, and time-consuming. Luckily, this task can be automated with the power of machine learning and pretty much every commercial bank does so nowadays. In this notebook, we will build an automatic credit card approval predictor using machine learning techniques, just like the real banks do.

item.title: Analyze International Debt Statistics using SQL
item.description: From developing countries to the world’s richest nations, most countries issue debt in order to finance their growth and manage their economy. This is similar to how a business will take out a loan to finance a new project, or how a family might take out a loan to buy a home. The World Bank is the organization that provides debt to countries. In this notebook, we will be analyzing international debt data collected by The World Bank.
